item.title: The Voyage of the Mothers: The Austronesian Expansion
item.description:
Location: The Pacific Genome Institute, Honolulu Subject: Matrilocality and the “Polynesian Motif”

If the Indo-European and Bantu expansions were stories of “Conquering Fathers,” the settlement of the Pacific is the story of “Voyaging Families,” anchored by a powerful, female-centric social structure.

Dr. Tane Maaka stood before a digital map of the Pacific Oceanâ€”the “Blue Continent.” It was the largest habitable space on Earth, and 3,500 years ago, a group of Neolithic sailors decided to cross it.

item.title: The Green Tsunami: The Bantu Expansion
item.description:
The Green Tsunami: The Bantu Expansion Location: The Great Lakes Region, East Africa Subject: The Convergence of Iron, Blood, and Syntax

While the Indo-European expansion was a story of horses and chariots across the open steppe, the Bantu Expansion was a story of iron axes and yam roots cutting through the dense heart of the continent. It is arguably the greatest migration in human history, turning a small group of speakers in West Africa (modern-day Cameroon/Nigeria border) into the dominant demographic force of the southern half of the continent.
